revised_title: Researches on the Structure, Organization, and Classification of Fossil Reptilia: Part IX, Section 4 - Gomphodontia
tldr: The author examines the structure, organization, and classification of the gomphodontia, a group of fossil reptiles with theriodont dentition. The study focuses on the skull structure, dental characteristics, and skeletal features of various genera, including Gomphognathus and Microgomphodon, providing insights into their relationship with other reptiles and mammals.
